thread.title: Chelsea duo Willian and Kenedy turn on the Samba style | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Chelsea duo Willian and Kenedy turn on the Samba style | Daily Mail Online

author: Harry Slavin For Mailonline
title: Chelsea duo Willian and Kenedy turn on the Samba style | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Willian led the showboating as the players waited in a marquee which had been set up on top of a plastic pitch. Surrounded by clothing racks and boxes for equipment, the pair killed time as they passed the ball between one and other while keeping it up in the air. Kenedy was busy trapping the ball between his thighs, while his team-mate performed around the worlds as they impressed in front of the camera. Willian has been a key figure for Antonio Conte's side this season, having missed just four league matches all season, scoring five times in his 20 outings. Kenedy rolls the ball the back of his thighs to flick the ball up with his heel, before juggling it Willian keeps his eyes on the ball as he goofs about with his team-mate on Chelsea's Instagram Willian has made 20 appearances in the Premier League for Antonio Conte's side this season The season has been a touch more frustrating for his club-mate and fellow countryman, who has struggled with a knee injury for the majority of it. Kenedy's one and only league appearance this season came during his loan spell at Watford, in a 2-0 defeat at Burnley, before injury curtailed his time at Vicarage Road. He has been selected by Conte just once since returning to fitness, in the FA Cup victory over Brentford, but should he be given the opportunity this weekend he'll be hoping to grab it, much like the football, with both thighs. Kenedy hasmade just one appearance for Chelsea this season and has struggled with injury RELATED ARTICLES
